work.description: My roles included being a sole server of a busy bar and restaurant during busy dinner shifts, delivering food and drinks to tables, and reporting and misbehaviour to managers.

I worked as a bar person / waiter at a busy restaurant and nightclub in Christchurch. My main responsibilities included taking care of large sections of the restaurant (20-30 people) and ensuring their meals and drinks were ordered and delivered in appropriate timing while also being aware of how my co workers were doing in other sections.

I worked as a production assistant prepping metal and assembling machinery for their high tech fruit processing/packaging machines. I then moved from prepping the metal pieces to assembling within 5 weeks as I showed a high level of competency in that area.

I worked a variety of roles while employed with Tradestaff. I did various roles such as scaffolding, general labour work, flooring/fencing and for my final long term role, I worked at a truck dealership in Hamilton where my 2 primary roles were ensuring the grounds were kept tidy, and helped the delivery/pickup of trucks to customers
I worked in a busy local cafe where I worked many roles - including kitchen work (prepping toasties/meals, cleaning dishes), serving customers, and making tasty coffee.

education.description: During my time at university, I was studying and working towards my Computer Science degree at Canterbury University, in Christchurch.
High School education. I studied the IB Diploma program here where I focused on higher subjects of Chemistry, Physics and Economics. I also studied English and Maths and Theory of Knowledge (TOK).

hobbies.description: I am an enthusiastic individual with a strong interest in programming. I enjoy the challenge programming brings me! I also enjoy playing guitar and the alto saxophone. I have a small dog who loves going for walks, so taking him for fun adventures is a highlight of my day.
